intro: Carlowrightia venturae, commonly known as the Ventura's carlowrightia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny conditions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
